docs.snippet: RIO DE JANEIRO, June 28  An underground war without quarter is being fought between Brazil's military Government and small cells of radical terrorists in the largest cities.
docs.lead_paragraph: RIO DE JANEIRO, June 28 An underground war without quarter is being fought between Brazil's military Government and small cells of radical terrorists in the largest cities.
docs.abstract: Article on urban guerrillas and their 2-yr underground struggle with Govt; guerrillas live in 2-5 person cells and are constantly on move; aims are to overthrow mil Govt and establish socialist state; activities have included bank robberies, kidnappings of 3 diplomats and gun battles in sts of Rio, Sao Paulo and Belo Horizonte; maximum number is estimated at 200, linked with 2 remaining groups, Popular Revolutionary Vanguard and Natl Liberating Alliance; 2 groups seen participating jointly for 1st time in von Holleben kidnapping; list of prisoners exchanged for von Holleben included 24 members from 2 groups including A de Carvalho, who has been linked with Action group; titular head of Action group is former congressman J Camara Ferreira, who reptdly was trying to unite guerrilla orgns earlier in yr; Action group is linked with faction of outlawed Brazilian Communist party while Vanguard has been linked with former Army Capt C Lamarca; Lamarca illus; 2 groups have not had single recognized leader since death of C Marighella in Nov '69

headline.main: Brazil's Urban Guerrillas Take High Toll in Killings and Thefts

byline.original: By JOSEPH NOVITSKI Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, July 2 (Reuters) Firebombs were tossed at, four Latin-American embassies here early today, soon after the Organization of American States approved funds for a special study of terrorism.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, July 2 (Reuters) Firebombs were tossed at, four Latin-American embassies here early today, soon after the Organization of American States approved funds for a special study of terrorism.
docs.abstract: Firebomb thrown at embassy, Washington, and those of 3 other nations following OAS approval of funds to study terrorism

docs.snippet: LONDON, July 3 (UPI) Carlos-Maria Velazquez, Uruguayan Ambassador to the Soviet Union and former head of the Uruguay mission to the United Nations, collapsed and died of a heart attack today in a hotel here. He was 52 years old. An embassy spokesman...
docs.lead_paragraph: LONDON, July 3 (UPI) Carlos-Maria Velazquez, Uruguayan Ambassador to the Soviet Union and former head of the Uruguay mission to the United Nations, collapsed and died of a heart attack today in a hotel here. He was 52 years old. An embassy spokesman said Dr. Velazquez, his wife and seven children were en route to Spain for a vacation.

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, July 7-The House Banking Committee approved today a further contribution of more than $1-billion over the next three years by the United States to the InterAmerican Development Bank.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, July 7-The House Banking Committee approved today a further contribution of more than $1-billion over the next three years by the United States to the InterAmerican Development Bank.
docs.abstract: HR Banking Com, in surprise move, combines funds bill for Inter-Amer Development Bank with bill approved earlier authorizing rise in US quota in IMF, rise in contribution to IBRD and 1st contribution of 'soft loan' funds to Asian Development Bank, lumping all internatl lending agencies together

headline.main: HOUSE UNIT VOTES LATIN BANK HELP; Committee Adding $1-Billion to Inter-American Fund

docs.snippet: MARLBORO, Vt., July 11 Officially the 20th Marlboro Music Festival opens tonight, though without any special observances. Special observances are not in the Marlboro style. Unofficially the festival opened last night with a concert in the dining room...
docs.lead_paragraph: MARLBORO, Vt., July 11 Officially the 20th Marlboro Music Festival opens tonight, though without any special observances. Special observances are not in the Marlboro style. Unofficially the festival opened last night with a concert in the dining room before a highly critical audience made up largely of members of the music staff.
docs.abstract: Marlboro (Vt) Music Festival: Festival plans; unofficial opening revd

byline.original: By HAROLD C. SCHONBERG Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, July 13  Israel, a country that has won acclaim for its relatively smal but effective technical coopera tion programs in Asia and Afri ca, is expanding similar activi ties in Latin America.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, July 13 Israel, a country that has won acclaim for its relatively smal but effective technical coopera tion programs in Asia and Afri ca, is expanding similar activi ties in Latin America.
docs.abstract: Israel signs 2-yr pact with OAS under which it will provide $250,000 for rural development programs in S Amer; planned projects include creation of experimental farms, community centers and co-ops; will be aimed at curbing migration of peasants from rural to urban areas; OAS Sec Gen Plaza Lasso holds helping rural population adjust to urban-oriented life may be largest undertaking in region in '70s

headline.main: Israel Signs Pact With O.A.S. to Widen Rural Development Work in Latin Lands
